Entries.default:
"Something must be wrong with my vision... No matter how much I blink, I-I cannot make out more than blurry lights in the darkness.

"But you... you are quite blinding..."
"Yeah, yeah. Into the lantern with you."
"I'm sorry, but you're dead. Come with me, I'll help you."
"Follow Gaun's light, all you lost souls, for it shall guide you through the Wheel."
"Follow along if you must. Just don't speak."

"Ekera, I will follow. You are hard to lose sight of."

The soul brushes up against you, too close for comfort.

"...Pain. ...I came to help one of the traders gather her belongings. 

"Then other men came... they struck me, over and over. Is that why I cannot see?"

"Let me ease this one's pain, Watcher."

Dark eyes solemn, Xoti circles her lantern around the departed soul.
"Dead?! But this is terrible." The spirit sighs, wispy shoulders slumping.
